title: Calc NGDP in 2006 and RGDP in 2010 from given data

content.question: In an economy, the price index in <math alttext="2006" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2006</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the real gross domestic product (<math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) was <math alttext="$1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>. In <math alttext="2010" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2010</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the price index was <math alttext="110" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>110</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was <math alttext="$2,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>200</mn></math>. Based on that information, which of the following can be inferred about the economyâ€™s nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="2006" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2006</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="2010" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2010</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2006 equals $2,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2006</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></math>; Real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2010 equals $1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2010</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></math>

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2006 equals $1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2006</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></math>; Real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2010 equals $2,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2010</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></math>

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2006 equals $1,100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2006</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>100</mn></math>; Real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2010 equals $2,420" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2010</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>420</mn></math>

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2006 equals $1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2006</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></math>; Real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2010 equals $2,420" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2010</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>420</mn></math>

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2006 equals $1,100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2006</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>100</mn></math>; Real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2010 equals $2,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2010</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>200</mn></math>

content.answer: Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2006 equals $1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2006</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></math>; Real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>GDP</mi></math> in <math alttext="2010 equals $2,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2010</mn><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></math>

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
